author: Anonym
title: Forecast for the weekend: The storms have passed - clear days ahead - voila! news - The Limited Times
text:
The flow of the Darga River entering the Dead Sea, 7 Feb. 2/Photo: Yoav Ari, Israel Nature and Parks Authority
The weather today (Friday) and tomorrow will be clear, and temperatures will be higher than normal for the season. On Sunday, there will be a slight cooling, and light localized rain is possible on the coastal plain.
See the full
weather forecast The expected temperatures in King today: Jerusalem 10-15, Tel Aviv 16-23. Haifa 15-19, Safed 11-14, Katzrin 13-20, Tiberias 15-22, Nazareth 13-18, Afula 13-21, Beit She'an 14-22, Lod 14-23, Ashdod 13-21, Ein Gedi 16-22, Beer Sheva 14-21, Mitzpe Ramon 9-14, Eilat 17-24.
The tri-border observation point in the Golan/Israel Nature and Parks Authority, Naama Mansfeld
Last weekend, stormy weather hit Israel, with rainstorms and strong winds leading to flooding and road blockages all over the country. Data from the Israel Meteorological Service indicate that most of the rains that weekend hit the communities in northern Israel. Some of the northern communities measured 100 mm of rainwater, with the national record recorded in the Technion campus in Haifa, where 147 mm of rain fell over the weekend. In the center, precipitation was mainly recorded at 30-20 mm, for example in the Tel Aviv area, and in the south almost no rainfall. "A cloud line now runs through the center, so the quantities there will rise," Porat promised.
Also at school the pellets in Tabor dropped 128 millimeters; Bibneel 116 mm; Safed 114 mm; in Kibbutz Eilon 104 mm; in Kibbutz Merom Golan 103 mm; plant 94 mm; Kibbutz Kfar Giladi 67 mm; Kibbutz Gilad 63 mm; Kibbutz Dafna 61 mm; rays of Samaria 57 mm; Shavei Zion 47 mm; Zichron Yaakov 47 mm; Gilboa leaf 38 mm; Ariel 38 mm; Green Village 31 mm; Hadera 21 mm; Tel Aviv 17 mm; Bet Dagan 2 mm; Jerusalem 1 mm; Kibbutz Negba 1 mm.
More on the subject: Weather Forecast
